subtitleNullable: Types, weaknesses, stats, abilities and moves for all of the 103 new Pokemon.
descriptionNullable:
# Background
What are the most common types in this generation? Who is the fastest Pokémon? Who is the strongest? And what moveset are they able to learn?

This dataset contains the stats, types, weaknesses, abilities and moves learned by all 103 new Pokémon introduced in the Scarlet & Violet games on the Nintendo Switch. The data does not include the 4 Paldean form Pokémon Tauros, Tauros Blaze Breed, Tauros Aqua Breed and Wooper.

Data was scraped from: https://serebii.net/ using R. There may be inconsistencies. One known inconsistency is that Type 1 and Type 2 values may be switched around for some Pokémon. For example, Skeledirge is known to have Type 1 of Fire and Type 2 of Ghost, but my dataset has Type 1 as Ghost and Type 2 as Fire.

# About the data
There are three data files:
- gen9\_pokemon_stats.csv
- gen9\_pokemon_abilities.csv
- gen9\_pokemon_moves.csv

### gen9\_pokemon_stats.csv
This file contains the Types, Stats and Weaknesses of all 103 Pokémon. Each record is a Pokémon.
- **Pokemon** - Name of the Pokémon [can be used as a Primary Key for other files]
- **Type 1** - First type of the Pokémon
- **Type 2** - Second type of the Pokémon, can be empty
- **HP** - Base HP stat of the Pokémon
- **Attack** - Base Attack stat of the Pokémon
- **Defense** - Base Defense stat of the Pokémon
- **Special Attack** - Base Special Attack stat of the Pokémon
- **Special Defense** - Base Special Defense stat of the Pokémon
- **Speed** - Base Speed stat of the Pokémon
- **Weakness-Type** - The damage multiplier applied to the Pokémon when hit by a move of this type. For example, 0.5 means the Pokémon would take halve damage, and 2 would mean the Pokémon takes double damage.

### gen9\_pokemon_abilities.csv
This file contains all abilities that the new Pokémon can have.
- **Ability** - Name of the ability
- **Pokemon** - Name of the Pokémon that can learn the ability
- **Game's Text** - The text within the game to describe the ability
- **In-Depth Effect** - Details about the effect of the ability, can be empty when the Game's Text already explains the ability in-depth
- **Ability URL** - URL to the webpage data was scraped from

### gen9\_pokemon_moves.csv
This file contains all moves that the new Pokémon can learn.
- **Move** - Name of the move
- **Type** - Type of the move
- **Category** - Category of the move (Physical / Special / Other)
- **Power Points** - The default PP for the move (number of times it can be used in battle)
- **Base Power** - Base power of the move
- **Accuracy** - Accuracy value of the move that determines if there is a chance it can miss
- **Battle Effect** - Description of the effect the move has in battle
- **Secondary Effect** - Description of any secondary effect the move may have
- **Secondary Rate** - Chance of the secondary effect occurring
- **Critical Rate** - Chance of the move being a critical hit (decimal value)
- **Speed Priority** - Determines if the move can go before other moves used in the same turn
- **Attack URL** - URL to the webpage data was scraped from
- **Pokemon** - Name of all Pokémon that can learn the move
title: Pokemon Generation 9 (Scarlet & Violet) Datasets
subtitle: Types, weaknesses, stats, abilities and moves for all of the 103 new Pokemon.
